moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4
comment:
Logical play, for oly in the
end-game can White turn his extra pawn on the King side to account.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4
comment: Accepting the challenge of "having it out in the centre".

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4 6. Qxd4 Qxd4 7. Nxd4 c5 8. Ne2 Bd7 9. Nbc3
comment:
Instead of this simple development, a more astute mobilisation result from 9.
b3.  9...

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4 6. Qxd4 Qxd4 7. Nxd4 c5 8. Ne2 Bd7 9. Nbc3 O-O-O
comment:
After his rapid and straighforward development, Black
has already overcome all the difficulties of the opening.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4 6. Qxd4 Qxd4 7. Nxd4 c5 8. Ne2 Bd7 9. Nbc3 O-O-O 10. Bf4 Bc6 11. O-O Nf6 12. f3
comment:
Thus White's majority in the centre is held for a long time to come.
12...

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4 6. Qxd4 Qxd4 7. Nxd4 c5 8. Ne2 Bd7 9. Nbc3 O-O-O 10. Bf4 Bc6 11. O-O Nf6 12. f3 Be7 13. Ng3 g6 14. Rfe1 Nd7 15. Nd1 Nb6 16. Nf1
comment:
With the idea of
controlling his "d2", but all yhis regrouping behind the front demonstrates
that all is not well with White.  16...

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4 6. Qxd4 Qxd4 7. Nxd4 c5 8. Ne2 Bd7 9. Nbc3 O-O-O 10. Bf4 Bc6 11. O-O Nf6 12. f3 Be7 13. Ng3 g6 14. Rfe1 Nd7 15. Nd1 Nb6 16. Nf1 Rd7 17. Be3 Rhd8
comment:
Black has mass
ed his troops on the critical sector and, in the sequel, will demonstrate that,
in spite of the exchange of Queens, the end-game is not yet, and the play
shows the sacrifices and other conceptions germane to the middle game.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4 6. Qxd4 Qxd4 7. Nxd4 c5 8. Ne2 Bd7 9. Nbc3 O-O-O 10. Bf4 Bc6 11. O-O Nf6 12. f3 Be7 13. Ng3 g6 14. Rfe1 Nd7 15. Nd1 Nb6 16. Nf1 Rd7 17. Be3 Rhd8 18. b3 c4

comment: ! - A magnificent conception, breaking down the King's defences.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4 6. Qxd4 Qxd4 7. Nxd4 c5 8. Ne2 Bd7 9. Nbc3 O-O-O 10. Bf4 Bc6 11. O-O Nf6 12. f3 Be7 13. Ng3 g6 14. Rfe1 Nd7 15. Nd1 Nb6 16. Nf1 Rd7 17. comment:
! - This resplendent pawn blockades, on its own, not only the adverse Knight
but the whole trio of white pawns on the King side.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4 6. Qxd4 Qxd4 7. Nxd4 c5 8. Ne2 Bd7 9. Nbc3 O-O-O 10. Bf4 Bc6 11. O-O Nf6 12. f3 Be7 13. Ng3 g6 14. Rfe1 Nd7 15. Nd1 Nb6 16. Nf1 Rd7 17. Kh2 Re8 32. a4 Kc7 33. h4 Kc6 34. c4 Bb4 35. Kh3 Re1
comment:
Masterly liquidations. In the ensuing ending,
Bishop against Knight, Black holds the trump cards.
